intro: Deeringothamnus rugelii var. pulchellus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
